experience.description: Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Morbi vitae tincidunt nunc.
Quisque imperdiet lectus nisl, a condimentum ipsum blandit quis. Proin egestas nunc felis, quis mattis tellus eleifend sed.
Mauris aliquam nunc et sem faucibus, sit amet cursus turpis viverra. Sed molestie volutpat vehicula. Maecenas eget viverra ligula.
Pellentesque tincidunt vel ante eu tincidunt. Phasellus elit arcu, eleifend id porttitor vel, cursus at turpis. Nullam et ornare sapien, in pretium nulla.
Praesent nec ligula ex. Proin suscipit lacinia enim non porttitor. Duis viverra placerat vestibulum. Curabitur vel massa finibus nunc facilisis congue.
In charge of all code reviews and merges for feature builds.
Part of team that built an angular-meteor-powered web portal for Dentists to create and manage their excess capacity by offering discounted slots.
Part of team that constructed an iOS and Android mobile app utilizing React Native that patients can use to view and take Dentist time slots.
Utilized built-in DDP (distributed data protocol) subscriptions to allow prospective patients to view slots being provided in real-time.
Using the location permission, the Google location API and several other parameters to aid in providing the most relevant Dental locations for prospective patients.
Sole developer of in-house budget tracking software using Ruby on Rails backend to power an Angular.js front-end.
Ultimately in charge of code reviews for all major feature builds.
Established several JavaScript IIFE patterns for adding new modules and integrated them via auto-injection based on controller path.
Part of team that constructed a scheduler with Ruby on Rails framework for as a SaaS as well as for a company that contracted our services.
Worked performing feature development (client and server side) on our platform consisting of Ruby on Rails framework applications, PostgreSQL and REDIS store, with unit and regression testing.
Tasked with converting Ruby on Rails model/view/controller for specific user-role experience to Angular.js factory/directive/service.
Broke down one of the platform applications from traditional MVC into controller/model driven api.  Helping to unify platform user experiences into a single application.
Assisted in conforming site experience of various user roles to follow accessibility standards.

Played a heavy role in building the JavaScript code from which product frames are rendered.  Major hurdles were reducing collisions with existing customer assets, maintaining a small file size, cross-compatibility and organization.  The tech stack utilized was grunt for compiling, yepnope for asynchronous asset loading, and dust templates for views.  This enabled the entire necessary code to exist in a single shop.js file.
Broke ground for the initial part of our platform: Shoppable Dashboard utilizing CodeIgniter.
Plays a customer support role for publishers trying to get Shoppable up and running.
Part of the team that built the Shoppable login portal for Merchants utilizing Ruby on Rails.

Design and construction of checkout views (initially via PHP then reconstructed in Ruby on Rails):  for enterprise users via rendering inside an iframe as well as self-serve where users are redirected to a 72Lux hosted checkout.
Whole lotta browser-compatibility testing: Desktop browsers, mobile browsers, tablets, different operating systems, etc...
After losing the first CTO, worked tirelessly to help fill in the gaps, write up documentation and interview potential replacements.
Worked as a web developer and constructed MySQL Data powered Building and Development Websites with the back end written in PHP and the front end in HTML, CSS and JavaScript/jQuery plugins
Developed a Site Application that utilized the CodeIgniter framework that provided database connections with additional logic that formed a back end to increase development efficiency
Developed a CRM in order for various versions of Design Comparables to be displayed for clients
Designed and developed multiple iOS applications for the iPad and iPhone for internal purposes
In charge of upgrading various site cross-compatibility issues
Provided modifications of various existing site issues specific to the listing service back end
Maintained the front and back end of http://leiterrealty.com/
Developed feature sets from assessed client needs
Developed websites to be Search Engine Recognized
Reverse-Engineer websites to troubleshoot existing issues
